Package javaArgs

Class Argument<Object>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaArgs.Argument<Object>
  • Type Parameters:
    Object - Type of the argument. In this abstract class, Object.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanArgument, IntegerArgument, StringArgument
    public abstract class Argument<Object>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class to define the desired behaviour of arguments.

    As this class cannot be instantiated, it's usage is bound to the classes that inherit from this one. These classes are BooleanArgument, StringArgument and IntegerArgument and represent the different types of argument available.

    Each of the said classes' Object parameter is the type of the argument. Can be Boolean, String or Integer.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ajordat

    • Method Detail

      • addToken

        public Argument<Object> addToken​(java.lang.String name,
                                 Object value)
        Method to add a token to the argument. Receives the token name and the value it's associated to.

        This method returns the Argument itself in order to chain token additions.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the token
        value - Value of the token
        Returns:
        Argument

      • addToken

        public Argument<Object> addToken​(java.lang.String name)
        Method to add a compound token to the argument. Receives only the token name, so when the input is parsed, JavaArgs will assume that the value of this token is specified following the token.

        This method returns the Argument itself in order to chain token additions.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the token
        Returns:
        Argument

      • useToken

        public abstract void useToken​(java.lang.String tokenName)
        Set the Argument's value to the value of the indicated token, retrieved from the token name.
        Parameters:
        tokenName - Name of the token the argument's value will be set from.

      • useToken

        public abstract void useToken​(ArgumentToken token)
        Set the Argument's value to the value of the received token.
        Parameters:
        token - Token from which to extract the value.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the object.

      • getValue

        public Object getValue()
        Get the value of the argument.
        Returns:
        The value of the argument.

      • isSet

        public boolean isSet()
        Get if the argument is set. The only case it returns false is when it's a mandatory argument that hasn't been set by the user.
        Returns:
        If the argument's value is set.
